intro: Lemna aoukikusa subsp. hokurikuensis, commonly known as the Hokuriku watermeal, is a small, free-floating aquatic plant native to Japan. It belongs to the genus Lemna, which is part of the family Araceae, known for its aquatic and semi-aquatic species. This subspecies is characterized by its tiny, oval-shaped leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in diameter. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in ponds and marshes. The plant reproduces rapidly through vegetative propagation, making it a common sight in freshwater habitats across its native range.
